name: The Royal Garden

reviews.text: Let me start (always an ominous start) by saying we had stayed at the Royal Garden about 6 times in the 1980's and 3 times in the 1990's.
reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be....

likes.liked: — It was clean and very rreminiscent of of our previoud trips
likes.disliked: — The food on offer in the buffet was appalling. we couldnt believe it compared to previous trips

reviews.text: It was fine, good even. Nothing wrong with it at all. it had all the same features that had made us return to it again and again in the past. Great service, lovely views, awesome atrium.
reviews.title: go time and time again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its in a great position. About 10 slow minutes walk from Nathan RD, but so close to the harbour and right next to the hong kong history and science museums, it is in a great position.
reviews.title: a true 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HOWEVER, the rooms were not very large and unlike all the other hotels we visited on the Asian trip, we were not offered to upgrade (which we would pay for... not for free). The breakfast buffet which we took up on one day was the poorest on offer during our stay in Asia and certainly wasnt worth the 200HKD we paid for it .
reviews.title: Great facilities

likes.liked: — Great pool, tennis court, and gym

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are staying at the RG, may we suggest the restaurant called sticky fingers or the deli france across the road.they werent 10/10 but they were better than the RG in value for money.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

likes.disliked: — Only half of the elevators go to the ground floor and there is no way of selecting them.

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed there for seven nights. I was on business and my wife was sightseeing. We had a lovely view of the harbour. The room was large,clean and quiet. The room was cleaned in the morning and in the evening the bed was turned down, a chocolate on the pillow and the towels changed.
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel

likes.disliked: — No information on typhoon warnings - had to watch the TV to find out anything during typhoon

reviews.title: Great stay at the Royal Garden
reviews.text: We had buffet breakfast in the Greenery every morning and we had enough to eat to not need lunch. My only gripe with breakfast was that I would have liked more choice of Asian foods. The attention of the service staff was excellent. One example, a guest dropped a serving spoon on the floor and attempted to place it back on the servery. A waitress took the spoon off him, said something to him, took the spoon away and replaced it with a clean spoon. Hygeine is always a worry when in another country and it was nice to see them being careful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at Royal Garden for 3 nights and it was a great experience for us. The service was great. The room and washroom are very clean and updated.
reviews.title: Wonderful Royal!

likes.liked: — room with harbor view + gym + spa + room service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have 2 little children with us and they have enough space to run and crawl around.
reviews.title: Hong Kong Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was also turndown of bed every evening (with fruits on the first night) with chocolate pieces placed on each pillow. The toiletries are great, with a set of shavers, toothbrush and toothpaste, on top of the normal set of toiletries. There is also a dispenser for drinking water (in addition to the flask to boil water), that we found was a rare gem. This is the first hotel we went that provides a dispenser for drinking water.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: I had a pleasant stay at the Royal Garden Hotel. The room and bathroom were both clean. The beds and pillows were comfortable. Of course I loved the flat screen tv on the wall.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My complaint is that we were given a room on the 16th floor and the elevator service is only up to the 15th floor. We were with our 2 small kids so it was such a hassle to be going up and down the stairs from the 15th floor to the 16th.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for three nights, and thought it was a pretty good deal. The hotel doesn't look much from the outside, but its pretty spectacular from the inside. The rooms are a decent size - not huge but roomy enough for two. We loved the crisp white bedding and 42 inch flat screen TV on the wall.
reviews.title: loved it!!!

likes.liked: — the location, the rooms, the great service!!

reviews.text: The bathroom was a little on the small side - but definitley okay. There is a fabulous roof top pool - didn't use it though as we ran out of time. We ate at Sabatini restaurant on the third floor, which had good write ups in all the guide books. It was pretty expensive but good food.
reviews.title: Get a corner room

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was pretty good. Really close to the Tsim Sha Sui promenade, close to the metro and only 10 mins walk from the huge harbourview mall and Nathan Rd.
reviews.title: Superb!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just come back from Hong Kong where we spent 8 nights at the Royal Garden Hotel in Kowloon. We found the hotel through tripadvisor.com (then rated in the top 10) and have to say that we were not disappointed. It was well appointed, the staff were helpful and friendly, the room (a deluxe room) was an excellent size, cleaned and maintained daily, and the amenities were excellent. The floor staff on our floor were exceptionally thoughtful.
reviews.title: Royal Garden Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was about a 5 minute walk to an MTR access point, a 10 minute walk to Nathan Rd, a 5 minute walk to the harbour, and about a 20 minute walk to the Star Ferry terminal. It is far enough away from the noise and din of Nathan Rd to be nicely quiet, yet not too far away to be a pain. We enjoyed our daily walk down Mody Rd to the bustling strip of Nathan Rd.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and clean, very handy location

reviews.text: It is hard to think of any negatives, although the price was a little higher than expected, possibly because we booked a deluxe room. However, the service we received was excellent as was access to the Sky Club and Business Lounge, also the partial harbour views (which the hotel understated) were a bonus.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would recommend this hotel to travellers and would definitely consider staying there again if we go back.
reviews.title: Love the pool
Very Good Hotel
reviews.text: A wonderful hotel, very clean and comfortable. Rooftop gym and pool were of very good quality and our room was just the ticket after a 12 hour flight.

aka: The Royal Garden Hotel Hong Kong
description: In its continuing pursuit of excellence and with a total investment of USD31 millions, the Royal Garden has just completed a sophisticated re-imaging programme of its 420 stylish guestrooms. The Royal Garden, conveniently located in the business and shopping areas of Tsimshatsui – a district well served by Hong Kong’s efficient public transport system (MTR), is the only hotel in Hong Kong with a 110-foot atrium, allowing natural daylight to illuminate the hotel’s interior by day and an exquisite ambience by night.The hotel has an impressive choice of the award winning and Michelin Recommended restaurants including Sabatini Ristorante Italiano, Inagiku Japanese restaurant, The Royal Garden Chinese Restaurant, The Greenery, Dong Lai Shun, Le Soleil and Martini Bar. **The roof-top swimming pool will be closed for refurbishment from January 14, 2013 till May 2014, however, an offsite swimming pool (within 3 minutes walking distance) will be arranged to enhance your comfort stay. During this time, hotel services and operations will be uninterrupted and we will make every effort to minimize any inconvenience.
